results.title: [Withdrawal syndrome following beta blocker therapy (author's transl)].
results.text_hl: An account is given of two cases of @<m>DISEASE_Substance_Withdrawal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013375 @@@withdrawal syndrome@@@ following discontinuation of an antihypertensive treatment with a single daily dose of Teneretic mite (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@/@CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlortalidone@@@).

results.title: Changes in blood pressure, heart rate and thyroid hormones after sudden withdrawal of pindolol and atenolol in hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: The only overall haemodynamic changes which was observed after the withdrawal was an overshoot in heart rate in the standing position in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group. Great inter-individual differences in the haemodynamic parameters were found, however, and changes suggestive for @<m>DISEASE_Substance_Withdrawal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013375 @@@withdrawal syndrome@@@ were found in 14 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@ = 7).

citations.NLM: Jespersen CM, Jørgensen PH, Krogsgaard AR, Friis T. Changes in blood pressure, heart rate and thyroid hormones after sudden withdrawal of pindolol and atenolol in hypertensive patients. Scand J Clin Lab Invest. 1986 Nov;46(7):615-21. PMID: 3538363
citations.BibTeX: @article{3538363, title={Changes in blood pressure, heart rate and thyroid hormones after sudden withdrawal of pindolol and atenolol in hypertensive patients.}, author={Jespersen CM and Jørgensen PH and Krogsgaard AR and Friis T}, journal={Scand J Clin Lab Invest}, volume={46}, number={7}, pages={615-21}}

results.title: The efficacy of atenolol in the outpatient management of the alcohol withdrawal syndrome. Results of a randomized clinical trial.
results.text_hl: Among @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who had @<m>DISEASE_Substance_Withdrawal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013375 @@@withdrawal symptoms@@@ at baseline, vital signs became normal more rapidly in the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and their abnormal behavioral characteristics also resolved more rapidly.

citations.NLM: Horwitz RI, Gottlieb LD, Kraus ML. The efficacy of atenolol in the outpatient management of the alcohol withdrawal syndrome. Results of a randomized clinical trial. Arch Intern Med. 1989 May;149(5):1089-93. PMID: 2719503
citations.BibTeX: @article{2719503, title={The efficacy of atenolol in the outpatient management of the alcohol withdrawal syndrome. Results of a randomized clinical trial.}, author={Horwitz RI and Gottlieb LD and Kraus ML}, journal={Arch Intern Med}, volume={149}, number={5}, pages={1089-93}}

results.title: The role of beta blockers in alcohol withdrawal syndrome.
results.text_hl: Among @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who had @<m>DISEASE_Substance_Withdrawal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013375 @@@withdrawal symptoms@@@ at baseline, vital signs became normal more rapidly in the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@; abnormal behavior and clinical characteristics also resolved more rapidly.

citations.NLM: Gottlieb LD. The role of beta blockers in alcohol withdrawal syndrome. Postgrad Med. 1988 Feb 29;Spec No():169-74. PMID: 2894658

results.title: Alcoholism.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Benzodiazepines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001569 @@@Benzodiazepines@@@ remain the most effective medications for the treatment of @CHEMICAL_Alcohols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000438 @@@alcohol@@@ withdrawal and for the prevention of withdrawal @DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizures@@@ and @DISEASE_Delirium @DISEASE_MESH:D003693 @@@delirium@@@, even though the adrenergic agents @CHEMICAL_Clonidine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003000 @@@clonidine@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ may hasten resolution of @<m>DISEASE_Substance_Withdrawal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013375 @@@withdrawal symptoms@@@ and facilitate @SPECIES_9606 @@@outpatient@@@ detoxification.

citations.NLM: Bohn MJ. Alcoholism. Psychiatr Clin North Am. 1993 Dec;16(4):679-92. PMID: 8309806
citations.BibTeX: @article{8309806, title={Alcoholism.}, author={Bohn MJ}, journal={Psychiatr Clin North Am}, volume={16}, number={4}, pages={679-92}}

results.title: [Neurobiology and pharmacotherapy of social phobia].
results.text_hl: Untoward effects, discontinuation-related @<m>DISEASE_Substance_Withdrawal_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013375 @@@withdrawal symptoms@@@ and abuse or dependence liability constitute major concerns about the use of @CHEMICAL_Benzodiazepines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001569 @@@benzodiazepines@@@, so they should be reserved for cases unresponsive to the safer medications cited above.

citations.NLM: Aouizerate B, Martin-Guehl C, Tignol J. [Neurobiology and pharmacotherapy of social phobia]. Encephale. 2004 Jul-Aug;30(4):301-13. PMID: 15538306
citations.BibTeX: @article{15538306, title={[Neurobiology and pharmacotherapy of social phobia].}, author={Aouizerate B and Martin-Guehl C and Tignol J}, journal={Encephale}, volume={30}, number={4}, pages={301-13}}
